intro: Manettia lygistum var. alba, commonly known as white manettia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. It is typically grown as a shade-loving plant in moist, well-drained soils.
